overview.heading: Overview
overview.content: Quikie Payroll is a smart payroll calculation engine built with JavaScript. It automates the complex task of calculating employee pay, including gross pay, tax deductions, and net salary for businesses.

challenge.heading: The Challenge
challenge.intro: The project aimed to solve the complexity of manual payroll processing, which is often slow and prone to human error.
keyPoints: Handling complex tax bands and statutory deductions accurately
Providing quick computations for large sets of employee data
Ensuring the calculation logic is easily verifiable and transparent
Maintaining a lightweight yet performant code structure

solution.heading: The Solution
solution.intro: I focused on building a pure JavaScript engine that handles computations efficiently in the browser, reducing the need for server-side roundtrips for simple calculations.

approaches.title: Modular Logic
approaches.description: Separated calculation rules into modular functions for easy maintenance and updates to tax laws.

approaches.title: Real-time Feedback
approaches.description: Enabled instant calculation updates as users input employee hours or salary details.

process.heading: Process
process.intro: The focus was on algorithmic accuracy and creating a distraction-free calculator interface.

steps.title: Logic Definition
steps.description: Mapping out the payroll rules and tax formulas into computational logic.

steps.title: Algorithm Testing
steps.description: Running thousands of test cases to ensure edge cases in pay calculation are handled.

steps.title: Minimalist UI
steps.description: Building a simple HTML/CSS interface that focuses entirely on data entry and results.

results.heading: Results
results.intro: Quikie Payroll demonstrates how clean code can solve significant business process bottlenecks.
